pds.cvSvc

Class MatDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • pds.cvSvc.MatDisplay

  • public class MatDisplay
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a means to easily display OpenCV Mats

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_HEIGHT 
      static int DEFAULT_WIDTH 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MatDisplay(java.lang.String title)
      Creates a JFrame to display any input image.
      MatDisplay(java.lang.String title, int x, int y)
      Creates a JFrame to display any input image, at the desired x,y location.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatDisplay

        public MatDisplay(java.lang.String title,
          int x,
          int y)
        Creates a JFrame to display any input image, at the desired x,y location. Exit button will free up resources but will not shut down the entire program.

      • MatDisplay

        public MatDisplay(java.lang.String title)
        Creates a JFrame to display any input image. Location defaults to (0,0).
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the window

    • Method Detail

      • updateResult

        public void updateResult(org.opencv.core.Mat img)
        Removes the previous Mat from the display and adds the input in its place
        Parameters:
        img - Image to show

      • displayDifference

        public void displayDifference(CVFrame previousFrame,
                     CVFrame currentFrame)
        Creates a matrix that represents the difference between the two input FrameNodes. This is down through a difference filter and subsequent edge detection. This method calls updateResult.

      • showRacketCandidates

        public void showRacketCandidates(CVFrame currentFrame)

      • showText

        public void showText(java.lang.String[] text)
